record.id: field.name="input" and file.name="format" and term=NULL and format.name=NULL and syslanguage="en"
record.field.name: input
record.file.name: format

brief.brief: The field name, as defined in the database dictionary (dbdict) record, for the table that the form accesses.
This field normally defines a data entry field, although it may refer to a structure on another form.

detail.detail: You can enter variables, but they are not considered 'fields'. If the field name entered is a structure, the format field of this entry must contain the name of the form used to display that structure.
These same rules apply to virtual joined data.

The input field contains the field in the source table that is the key to the target table. The format field contains name of the form used to display retrieved data from the target table. The input entries of the structure/virtual join format must contain the field names of the fields to display on that format.
